下場D33停賽 佢實出

Inter coach Luciano Spalletti was understandably disappointed after the final whistle between Inter and Juventus at the Stadio Giuseppe Meazza in Milano’s San Siro district.

Spalletti began by stating that “the team struggled, we managed to held up against most of the attacks after 2-1 but playing with 10 men had its cost of both breath and strength. And then their second goal was very tough psychologically. Of course the third goal came as a result of the disappointment of the equalizer.”

Spalletti was then asked about the Mauro Icardi substitution: “I wanted to sub Perisic but he told me he was ok, that he could participate also in the defensive phase and that he was able to do a 50 meter run in order to defend our goal so the choice was Icardi. If that was a bad substitution I will pay the consequences of that.

“The team deserved the win, they had a great game, with a lot of sacrifices, intensity and the defensive line always was man to man. We could have made a go for the third goal, Icardi almost got there, but we spent a lot of energy on playing 10 against 11. First on pushing up on the left side then on the right and even if it seems to be casual we payed for that during the final stage of the game. We held up very well for most of the game but at the final minutes it just got to hard. We saw a great Inter, but the final result is tough to accept. Sometimes the player perform in a way that makes you think they only play for the money and do not care about the club. Instead they showed us tonight that they have sensitivity, a soul and that they want to bring joy to all the fans watching at home and at the stadium, a crowd that tonight deserved so much more than they got. The team showed great professionalism and an ever bigger heart” Spalletti concluded.

北京時間2018年4月30日，據《意大利足球》報導，國際米蘭vs祖雲達斯一戰中，祖雲達斯主帥艾歷尼與當值第四官員塔利亞文托的交談有干涉比賽之嫌，意大利足協已就此展開調查。

調查重點在賽後混合區艾歷尼和塔利亞文托見面時，艾歷尼先是用昵稱「塔利亞」稱呼這位第四官員，並對其「授意」提拔當值球證奧爾薩托：「他表現的很出色，是時候晉升他了。」他們在交談過程中用的意大利語「promosso」，是用來形容通過某種測試而獲得了提升。

還有一個爭議鏡頭，祖安古亞達度將比分扳至2比2時，第四官員塔利亞文托疑似向艾歷尼表示「我們將在傷停補時勝出」。意足協將派出專員佩柯拉羅調查此事，這位專職調查員將通過回放錄影、觀察嘴形和讀唇等一系列方式判斷艾歷尼和塔利亞文托是否有違規的交涉。

通常情況下，比賽中第四官員只負責換人，以及協助球證公佈傷停補時時間，所以艾歷尼和塔利亞文托的爭議是否屬實，以及第四官員能在多大許可權內干涉比賽仍需進一步調查。


真係做到咁明顯？

Discussing Inter vs. Juventus and the Nerazzurri's end to the season, CEO Alessandro Antonello recently had this to say to Inter TV.
Two days have now passed since the Juventus match.

Have you got the anger out of your system yet?

"Definitely not. The boss had asked the team to be really ferocious out there and that’s what we did. Some unacceptable things happened and we’re furious. The club deserves respect and so do our fans."

Is there a risk that this might cause you to lose focus with just three games to go until the end of the season? As Steven Zhang said after the game, it’s vital that the team wins its next few games to try to achieve the objective of securing Champions League football next season.

"There won’t be any loss of focus. The lads showed what they can do on the pitch. They’re all great professionals and we’re expecting a quick reaction. Our objective hasn’t changed and we’ll show that on Sunday against Udinese.

You were at Appiano Gentile yesterday with the whole management team. How important are the next few days in terms of re-energising the players ahead of the vital Udinese game?

"I want to make it clear that both myself and the entire management team have been right behind the team all season. Perhaps some people want to create a different narrative, but I can guarantee that we’re all united and focused on achieving our season objective of a place in next year’s Champions League."

What message do you have for the coach, the team and the fans?

"We’ve lost the battle and I think you can probably say it wasn’t our fault alone. But we want to win the war, for ourselves and for our fans."

How pleasing was it to see Inter outplaying Juventus even when they were a man light?

"We’re proud of the performance the lads put in. They put their heart and soul into the game despite being down to ten men. Our fans were absolutely exceptional too – they cheered us on from start to finish."

Have you seen the video of Massimiliano Allegri and Paolo Tagliavento? It’s creating a lot of anger among fans. Miralem Pjanic also talked of the referee "compensating" with his yellow cards. What do you make of it all?

"Everybody can see what happened. It was seen by 80,000 people at the stadium and by 700,000 people across 170 countries around the world. It definitely didn’t showcase the best of Italian football. In fact, I’d say it’s shown our game in a very bad light.

When you go back over the incidents, it’s clear that several penalised Inter. What do you think about that?

"We decided to wait until today to comment because we didn’t want to speak in the heat of the moment and risk being influenced by all the emotions flying about. We’ve watched all of the incidents back and we cannot explain why two sets of weights and measures were used in the same game. Lots of things are changing in football, but it seems like some things always stay the same. Having said that, we’re proud of the history we have at this club."

Serie A teams have now set their sights on talented Brescia prospect Sandro Tonali. The midfielder born in ‘2000 is currently represented by Roberto Lo Florio, he recently scored his first goal in Italy’s second division last Saturday and has attracted the interest of Sampdoria and especially Inter. But Brescia president Cellino doesn’t intend to let him leave easily, he has already turned down offers of around 10 million euro, including bonuses. The idea is to keep him at Brescia for another season period prior to selling him for a higher price, including a percentage on future resale. Tonali has recently drawn comparisons to another former Brescia midfielder Andrea Pirlo- his future could take place in Serie A.

Valencia is enamored with Kondgobia- starting with Marcelino. The manager has relied heavily on the French midfielder who started 34 matches and played for a total of 2935 minutes so far this season, second most on the team after captain Parejo. And now with the Spanish club on the verge of qualifying for the Champions League, they are making plans to keep Kondogbia beyond this season. Valencia intend to exercise their option to buy Kondogbia from Inter for 25 million euro payable in four years. Last weekend the French player’s agents were in Valencia to meet with the clubs, there’s mutual appreciation and intent to continue together moving forward: the deal is very close to being agreed to.

Mauro Icardi has scored 28 goals in Serie A this season; the most by an Inter Milan player in a single campaign since Antonio Angelillo (33) in 1958/59.

As for Inter, they have made another offer for Filip Benkovic, Croatian defender from the class of 1997. They have been following him for a while, including different conversations that took place last year. The player is regarded as one of the most promising young defenders in Europe.

Rafinha joined Inter from Barcelona in January, and he has been a great addition to the nerazzurri. His future is uncertain, however, as he is only on loan and Inter have a 35 million euro purchase clause. He spoke to Globoesporte about his time at Inter and his current situation: "I know very well that it doesn't depend on me, but I am very well here and my desire is to remain. Obviously there is always nostalgia for Barcelona, but in Milan I have found a great environment and stupendous teammates. I am happy here. For someone who just joined a few months ago, I feel like I have been at Inter for years. My insertion was simple, I immediately felt at ease. My teammates? I get along very well in particular with the Brazilians, but I must say that I immediately got along with everyone. A special mention to Mauro Icardi, who I want to thank.I knew him from when I was 16 years old and he explained to me what it means to play for Inter. Inter has always trusted and believed in me, thanks to this club I discovered my joy to play football. I really hope that I can remain here."

Roma and Inter have made initial contact with the player's entourage, but they still yet to understand Atalanta's will, as they still have to decide a price. In the meantime, Inter and Roma are reflecting and starting the first steps of a negotiation that may begin in earnest in the coming months. Atalanta are waiting for the first official moves and pondering about what to do.

Inter Milan Reportedly 'Determined' to Re-Sign Mateo Kovacic from Real Madrid

Inter Milan are reportedly eyeing a move to re-sign Mateo Kovacic from Real Madrid in the summer, three years after selling the midfielder to Los Blancos.

According to Corriere dello Sport, Inter director of football Piero Ausilio is "determined" to bring the Croatia international back at the end of the season and talks have opened around a €30 million (£26 million) deal, paid in instalments.

The report also links Kovacic, 23, with a move to Liverpool, and the Premier League outfit could likely offer a big transfer fee should they want him.

Kovacic has struggled for regular first-team action at Real. In the three seasons he has spent at the Santiago Bernabeu, he has started only 35 games in La Liga.

That is not a huge surprise given he is competing for a place with Luka Modric and Toni Kroos, who arguably comprise best central-midfield duo in the world.

However, when he has been given a chance, he has impressed. And his statistics stand up to scrutiny, per Squawka:

Modric will be 33 in September and is likely to play a more limited role relatively soon. In Kovacic, Real have a ready-made replacement, and it would be a big surprise were manager Zinedine Zidane open to letting him leave.

Real could surely only be tempted to sell Kovacic if an astronomical offer came in. In this market, €30 million would be far from value for the selling club.

Kovacic has the potential to become one of the best central midfielders in the world, and Real can offer him realistic ambitions of winning a lot of major silverware in the coming years.

Inter remain a huge club, but their competitiveness at both the domestic and European levels has waned in recent years.

Unless Kovacic agitates for a move back to the San Siro, it does not seem a likely switch.

重簽K10

【國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院】暑期班正式招生！

如果你想有一個大汗淋漓但又充滿歡樂的暑假，就快快報名參加【國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院】2018暑期班啦！

特別優惠 :
- 首50名報名學員可以免費在7月29 / 30日由「國際米蘭」現任副主席兼前球隊隊長辛尼迪 (Javier Zanetti) 主持的訓練課堂，訓練長度約一小時
- 首80名學員可以免費在6月16日由「國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院」舉辦的「父親節親子足球嘉年華」
- 5月30日前報名參加「國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院暑期班2018」，學費減$200、送訓練套裝一套(包括衫褲襪)及免費送「國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院」永久會藉和「國際米蘭香港球迷會」一年小童會員會藉
- 6月15日前報名參加「國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院暑期班2018」，學費減$100及送訓練套裝一套(包括衫褲襪) 及免費送「國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院」永久會藉和「國際米蘭香港球迷會」一年小童會員會藉
- 參加此暑期班的學生，如之後參加我們舉辦的恆常兒童班，可享首月減$100優惠

歐洲最專業及最有系統的訓練，盡在【國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院】！詳細資料請在網上報名或下載報名表格，期待在夏日跟你們狂歡享受足球又學到野！

報名方法
1. 網上報名：
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdQsPbRbaX-z0yKpqpvZkKDWzQf10tMCPpExxcniv_gl4VJ0g/viewform?c=0&w=1
2. 下載報名表格後將填好表格whatsapp或email或郵寄給我們：
Inter Academy Form - Download link：https://drive.google.com/open?id=1lo9XPHnKrC2PHoT7NHU0JbFnCXQDRLCn

各位有意參加的朋友請留意，由於已經好多人填左報名表格，首50名名額計算會按網上報名或email或whatsapp給我們的時間作準，寄信報名應該會是最慢，大家請留意。是此活動資格是以先報先得為準，稍後會公布首50名參加者姓名作實。
關於分班上，我們會按年齡分開組，而上堂後會即因應能力再將球員分配到適合組別，絕對不用擔心能力相差的問題。

最後請留意，所有人需待我們確認報名正確後，才將學費存入給我們指定戶口。成功存入後請把入數收據whatsapp或電郵給我們作實。

【國際米蘭(香港)青訓學院】暑期班聯絡方式：
WhatsApp或電話查詢號碼：5546 0045
Email：soarfdc@gmail.com
郵寄地址：九龍荔枝角道781號宏昌工廠大廈第一座220C室
Flat/Rm 220C, Block 1, Wang Cheong F/Bldg.,781 Lai Chi Kok Road, Kowloon
